1.name: All Quiet on the Western Front
1.description: A young soldier faces profound disillusionment in the soul-destroying horror of World War I.

2.name: Hell's Angels
2.description: Brothers Monte and Ray leave Oxford to join the Royal Flying Corps. Ray loves Helen; Helen enjoys an affair with Monte; before they leave on their mission over Germany they find her in still another man's arms.

3.name: Der blaue Engel
3.description: An elderly professor's ordered life spins dangerously out of control when he falls for a nightclub singer.

4.name: Redemption
4.description: Fedya wins Lisa away from her fiance, Victor Karenin. But after Fedya weds Lisa, he becomes infatuated with a gypsy girl, Masha. His duplicity leads to tragedy.

5.name: Morocco
5.description: A cabaret singer and a Legionnaire fall in love, but their relationship is complicated by the results of his womanizing and due to the appearance of a rich man who wants her for himself.

6.name: L'âge d'or
6.description: A surrealist tale of a man and a woman who are passionately in love with each other, but their attempts to consummate that passion are constantly thwarted by their families, the Church, and bourgeois society.

7.name: Animal Crackers
7.description: Mayhem and zaniness ensue when a valuable painting goes missing during a party in honor of famed African explorer Captain Spaulding.

8.name: Murder!
8.description: A juror in a murder trial, after voting to convict, has second thoughts and begins to investigate on his own before the execution.

9.name: Maybe It's Love
9.description: A college football player (Joe E. Brown) persuades a beautiful young woman (Joan Bennett) to individually flirt with an entire team of All-American football players, in order to entice them...                See full summary »

10.name: The Big Trail
10.description: Breck Coleman leads hundreds of settlers in covered wagons from the Mississippi River to their destiny out West.

11.name: Madam Satan
11.description: Angela and Bob Brooks are an upper class couple. Unfortunately, Bob is an unfaithful husband. But Angela has a plan to win back her husband's affections. An elaborate masquerade ball is to ...                See full summary »

12.name: Menschen am Sonntag
12.description: Two men and two women enjoy a pleasant Sunday at the beach amid the unending toil of the working week.

13.name: Little Rascals: Best of Our Gang
13.description: Spanky, Buckwheat, Porky and all The Little Rascals at their hilarious best!

14.name: Anna Christie
14.description: A young woman reunites with her estranged father and falls in love with a sailor, but struggles to tell them about her dark past.

15.name: Up the River
15.description: When paroled trustee Steve and former inmate Judy who try to put their criminal lives behind them are blackmailed, two career criminals come to their rescue.

16.name: Ladies of Leisure
16.description: An upper-crust artist hires a 'party girl' as a model; romance follows.

17.name: The Unholy Three
17.description: "Talkie" remake of Tod Browning's 1925 silent film. A trio of former sideshow performers double as the "Unholy Three" in a scam to nab some shiny rocks.

18.name: Zemlya
18.description: In the peaceful countryside, Vassily opposes the rich kulaks over the coming of collective farming.

19.name: The Bat Whispers
19.description: A master criminal terrorizes the occupants of an isolated country mansion.

20.name: The Divorcee
20.description: When a woman discovers that her husband has been unfaithful to her, she decides to respond to his infidelities in kind.

21.name: The Doorway to Hell
21.description: Despite his efforts to go straight, a young gangster keeps falling back into crime.

22.name: Abraham Lincoln
22.description: An episodic biography of the 16th President of the United States.

23.name: City Girl
23.description: A Chicago waitress falls in love with a Minnesota farmer, and decides to face a life in the country.

24.name: Just Imagine
24.description: New York, 1980: airplanes have replaced cars, numbers have replaced names, pills have replaced food, government-arranged marriages have replaced love, and test tube babies have replaced ......                See full summary »

25.name: Montana Moon
25.description: While returning to Montana from a fling in New York, wealthy Joan Prescott leaves the train, intending to return to the big city. She runs into handsome cowboy Larry and gets engaged. On ...                See full summary »

26.name: The Big House
26.description: A convict falls in love with his new cellmate's sister, only to become embroiled in a planned break-out which is certain to have lethal consequences.

27.name: Loose Ankles
27.description: In this light romantic comedy, 17-year old Loretta Young is cast as Ann Harper, a wealthy socialite who has inherited a fortune provided the family is involved in no scandals appearing in ...                See full summary »

28.name: King of Jazz
28.description: American Pre-Code color film starring Paul Whiteman and his Jazz orchestra.

29.name: Westfront 1918: Vier von der Infanterie
29.description: A group of German infantrymen of the First World War live out their lives in the trenches of France. They find brief entertainment and relief in a village behind the lines, but primarily ...                See full summary »

30.name: Juno and the Paycock
30.description: During the Irish Civil War in 1922, a family earns a big inheritance. They start leading a rich life, forgetting what the most important values are.

31.name: Whoopee!
31.description: Western sheriff Bob Wells is preparing to marry Sally Morgan; she loves part-Indian Wanenis, whose race is an obstacle. Sally flees the wedding with hypochondriac Henry Williams, who thinks...                See full summary »

32.name: Liliom
32.description: Liliom, a merry-go-round barker at a Budapest amusement park, becomes enamored of Julie, a servant girl, and though under the influence of Madame Muskat, a sideshow entrepreneur, he marries...                See full summary »

33.name: Journey's End
33.description: In France, 1917, an alcoholic captain is afraid that his new replacement, his sweetheart's brother, will betray his downfall.

34.name: Free and Easy
34.description: A bumbling manager tries to get a small town beauty contest winner into the movies.

35.name: Paramount on Parade
35.description: A musical revue that basically has Paramount stars and contract-players doing things some had never done on screen, and wouldn't again; such as Ruth Chatteron , in a French-café setting ...                See full summary »

36.name: Sous les toits de Paris
36.description: Albert is smitten for Pola but ends up wrongly committed in jail, in the meantime her affections are sought after by his friend, and on his release both love and friendship must be tested.

37.name: Soup to Nuts
37.description: Mr. Schmidt's costume store is bankrupt because he spends his time on Rube Goldberg-style inventions; the creditors send a young manager who falls for Schmidt's niece Louise, but she'll ...                See full summary »

38.name: Safety in Numbers
38.description: A songwriter hires three chorus girls to show him the "underside" of big-city life.

39.name: Romance
39.description: Young Harry is in love and wants to marry an actress, much to the displeasure of his family. Harry thinks that Bishop Armstrong knows nothing about love so Armstrong tells him the story of ...                See full summary »

40.name: The Dawn Patrol
40.description: World War I ace Dick Courtney derides the leadership of his superior officer, but Courtney is soon promoted to squadron commander and learns harsh lessons about sending subordinates to their deaths.

41.name: The Texan
41.description: An outlaw, the Llano Kid is the scourge of south Texas and a Bible quoting lawman named Thacker. The kid joins a con man in a plot to deceive a wealthy old woman that he's her long-lost son...                See full summary »

42.name: Doughboys
42.description: A naive and wealthy young man seeks to impress a girl and then unwittingly signs up for army service.

43.name: Moby Dick
43.description: In this extremely loose adaptation of Melville's classic novel, Ahab is revealed initially not as a bitter and vengeful madman, but as a bit of a lovable scamp. Ashore in New Bedford, he ...                See full summary »

44.name: Sinners' Holiday
44.description: Ma Delano (La Verne) runs a boardwalk penny arcade, living upstairs with her sons (Cagney and Gallagher) and daughter (Knapp). Story involves rum running, accidental murder and a frame-up.

45.name: Min and Bill
45.description: Min, the owner of a dockside hotel, is forced to make difficult decisions about the future of Nancy, the young woman she took in as an infant.

46.name: Sin Takes a Holiday
46.description: Dowdy Sylvia accepts her boss' marriage proposal, even though he only asked her to avoid marriage to another woman. As a wealthy wife, Sylvia changes from ugly duckling to uninhibited swan ...                See full summary »

47.name: Paid
47.description: Mary Turner goes up for three years on a crime she didn't commit. Once out she and former prison mates plan a scam in which old men can be sued for breach of promise - the "heart balm" ...                See full summary »

48.name: Anybody's Woman
48.description: A man, left by his wife, gets drunk and marries a chorus girl.

49.name: The Naughty Flirt
49.description: Rich party girl sets her eyes on a young attorney.

50.name: The Lady of Scandal
50.description: A famous British actress gets involved with two members of a reserved British noble family, whose plan to get rid of her backfires.
